text: You can do so locally by editing the `meta.json` `host_template_types` array to include `BLOG_POST`. Or you can do so in the design manager by navigating to the module, and looking for Template types and clicking the link underneath it, and checking Blog Posts. Also make sure `Make available in templates and pages` is checked. <https://cdn.vizality.com/u/XRaqEZXxxZ.png> <https://cdn.vizality.com/u/plahGWtEDl.png>

Does anyone know what's wrong with not having `src` be wrapped in quotes? <https://cdn.vizality.com/u/ct7KcC1dbk.png> works but without the quotes around `src`, it gives <https://cdn.vizality.com/u/1xmaaw1weI.png>
It seems to have to do with `get_asset_url` but can anyone explain why or how to get around it?

I think you need quotes around all the names. The way it worked for me was to wrap the get_asset_url in quotes and then brackets, like `"src" : "{{ get_asset_url('/images/image-name.jpg') }}"` . I ended up not doing it though since the Marketplace team weren't fans :shrug:
